content.description: Climb the ever steepening tower on very unique chert, sharp edges, and fossilized rock up to a rap anchor/midway station (5.8ish). From here follow the line of bolts on the right (left bolted line goes at .11c) up into the exposed steepness, and a short edgy crux before making the chains just shy of the summit (.10b). The towers summit is a bit chossy, but you can soak in some beautiful views & wild exposure while on the very small summit plateau.
content.protection: 15 bolts to chain anchor just shy of the towers summit.   Midway anchor for rapping down (5.8ish to that point).
content.location:
The Northwest face of the tower (left side when viewing it from the wash below) has four bolted lines, this one being the second line from the right. Start on top of a large block that makes up the lower right potion of this face.   

  Desent- single rope rap from summit to the midway anchor, from here rap over onto the southwest face (60m get you on top of a large boulder, 70m makes the ground, partial free rap).

content.description: Cool, low-angle chert climb to the top.  5.9 to the midpoint anchor (stop here on your way down if climbing with a 60m).
content.protection: MANY draws and a 70m with STRETCH. Recommend 80m. 15 bolts.
content.location: Right-most climb on the Northwest face.  Starts the same as Smelling the Rose, and then breaks right. Start off the top of the boulder.

content.description: The Northwest Face of the Phalanx of Will holds some super long moderates from 5.7 up to 5.11 on wild limestone with chert and coral nodules abound. Many of the routes feel adventurous and can take you to the top of the tower for an incredible view of this remote area!
